user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of atomic:
```c
static int atomic(void)
{
	const int threads = 10;
	atomic_int counter = ATOMIC_VAR_INIT(0);
	int value, error;

	error = metal_run(threads, atomic_thread, &counter);
	if (!error) {
		value = atomic_load(&counter);
		value -= atomic_test_count * threads;
		if (value) {
			metal_log(METAL_LOG_DEBUG, "counter mismatch, delta = %d\n",
				  value);
			error = -EINVAL;
		}
	}

	return error;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function atomic:
int metal_run(int threads, metal_thread_t child, void *arg)
{
	pthread_t tids[threads];
	int error, ts_created;

	error = metal_run_noblock(threads, child, arg, tids, &ts_created);

	metal_finish_threads(ts_created, (void *)tids);

	return error;
}
...
static void *atomic_thread(void *arg)
{
	atomic_int *c = arg;
	int i;

	for (i = 0; i < atomic_test_count; i++)
		atomic_fetch_add(c, 1);

	return NULL;
}
...
#define metal_log(level, fmt, __VA_ARGS__) ({if(_metal.common.log_handler&&level<=_metal.common.log_level)_metal.common.log_handler(level,metal_fmt(fmt),##__VA_ARGS__);\
})
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
int metal_run(int threads, metal_thread_t child, void *arg)
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The void *arg parameter is used to pass a pointer to a mutable object (the counter) into worker threads; atomic_thread casts arg to atomic_int * and modifies *c with atomic_fetch_add. Because the pointee is intentionally mutated by the thread function, arg must not be const-qualified. Therefore Rule 8.13 is not violated.
